Name: bai bu
Other name: ye tian men dong 野天門冬

Geography: Hubei (Stemona sessilifolia, Stemona japonica, Stemona tuberosa)
Maladies Treated: Pubic Phthiriasis (head lice, crabs, body lice)
For:润肺 下氣止 咳，殺蟲 (moistens Lung, descends Qi, stops coughing, kills parasites). Used for new and long-lasting cough, pulmonary tuberculosis cough, whooping cough.
External use for head lice, body lice, pinworm disease, pubic lice
Pinworm disease: raw bai bu applied as enema inside colon at night and retained overnight, one course is five days
Medical Function: Moistens Lung, descends Qi, stops cough
Samples of Formulae:
For chronic cough with abundance of phlegm: Name of formula: bai bu tang. Composition: bai bu (stemona root), mai dong (ophiopogon tuber), sha shen (adenophora root), sang bai pi (mulberry root bark), bai he (lily bulb), fu ling (poria), di gu pi (lycium bark), yi yi ren (coix seed), huang qi (astragalus root).

For pinworms: Formula: raw bai bu (stemona root) 30 g, water 400 c.c. Simmer till 30 c.c. Apply liquid inside colon during night time. Let liquid stay overnight. Five days is a therapy period.
Contraindications: Not to use in cases of pixu (spleen deficient) with loose stool (脾虛 便溏忌用).

Name: ban mao
Biological: Mylabris cichori Linnaeus (眼斑芫青/黃黑小斑蝥)
Other name: lao hu ban mao 老虎斑毛 (Jiangsu)

Geography: Most parts of China, mainly in Jiangsu, Anhui, Shanxi, Shandong, and Hubei; also in Guangdong, Taiwan, Fujian
Maladies Treated: masses and abdominal lumps: for treating zheng jia tumors and abdominal swelling
abscesses and carbuncles that do not ulcerate
Medical Function: anti-tumor activity: the extract of ban mao suppresses metabolism of human esophageal cancer, cardia cancer, stomach cancer, lung cancer, and splenic sarcoma cells
inhibits liver damage caused by carbon tetrachloride (CCl4) and the increase of ALT
Contraindications:
Symptoms of toxicity appear a little more than 20 minutes after ingestion and include burning sensation in the throat and mouth, dizziness, nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, frequent urination, burning sensation in the urinary tract, difficulty in urination, blood in urine, and protein in urine. Severe cases may result in scant urine, urinary retention, elevated BUN and creatinine, and kidney failure.

Pregnancy is contraindicated. 

Contact toxicity: Skin or mucosal contact with ban mao causes burning pain, congestion, blisters, mouth erosion and ulceration, and with prolonged exposure, skin necrosis.

Do not eat foods containing fat or oil during treatment period, to avoid accelerating toxin absorption.
Research:
About a little more than 20 minutes after ingesting ban mao, the toxicity shows. The symptoms include burning sensation in the throat and mouth, dizziness, nausea, vomiting, pain in the abdomen area, frequent urination, burning sensation in the urinary tract, difficulty in urination, blood in urine, and protein in urine. In serious cases, there can be a lack of urine, inability to urinate, elevated BUN and creatinine, exhaustion of kidney function.

Contact with the skin or mucous membrane causes burning pain, congestion, blisters, oral erosion, ulceration, and, in prolonged cases, skin necrosis.

Antidote methods as documented (not necessarily proven effective): In early stages of toxic reaction, use gastric lavage. Then, drink milk and/or liquid egg white to protect gastric mucosa or take 10ml of 10% aluminum hydroxide gel every half hour. If no abdominal pain or diarrhea, ingest 50% magnesium sulfate with caution to induce diarrhea and expel toxins. Activated charcoal or salt-type laxative can be given to lessen toxin absorption. Supplement fluid to maintain electrolyte balance. Penicillin can be injected intramuscularly to prevent infection. Address symptoms as they appear. In case of upper digestive tract bleeding, arrest the bleeding; if serious, transfuse blood. In case of uremia, use hemodialysis. If peripheral circulation fails, supplement blood and use vasodilator. Since ban mao toxin (canthavidin) is fat soluble, do not ingest oil or fat during treatment period to avoid accelerating toxin absorption. Folk therapy includes decoction of lu dou (mung bean), gan cao (licorice), hei dou (black bean), green onion, and tea leaves for detoxification and bleeding arrest. For skin contact injury, use 1% gentian violet for topical application.

Geography: Throughout south east Asia and southern China
Maladies Treated: 痤瘡 Acne (external application to affected areas during herbal wash, as part of formula)
皮膚癢 Itchy skin (as part of formula)
Cancer of digestive tract (as part of formula)
Medical Function: Clearing heat, fire toxicity, abscesses, toxic sores, ulcerations, swellings
Stimulates the body's own immune system function and improves the body's resistance
Strong inhibitory effect on viral hepatitis HbsAg [1]
Can activate reticuloendothelial system and increase phagocytosis by lymphocytes
In high concentrations, preparations have shown to inhibit cells from acute lymphocytic and acute granulocytic leukemia
Effective in the treatment of appendicitis
Treatment of snake bites: applied topically and taken orally
Dosage:
10 ~ 30 g.
In the event of allergies, prevention is recommended by starting with a small amount, such as 10 grams, and gradually increasing to 30-60 grams.
Samples of Formulae:
For itchy skin: bai hua she she cao (white flower snake tongue herb) 30 g, sheng di huang (rehmannia root) 15 g, tu fu ling (smilax glabra rhizome) 12 g, add 1 pound of pond loach (Misgurnus anguillicaudatus, ni qiu). Add water and make soup.

Cancer of digestive tract; hemorrhoids: bai hua she she cao (white flower snake tongue herb), ban zhi lian (Barbat skullcap), and mao gen (Imperata root), make into decoction. It is especially effective for cancer of the rectum or hemorrhoid.

Acne: bai hua she she cao (white flower snake tongue herb) 20 g, mai dong (ophiopogon root) 15 g, sheng di huang (rehmannia root) 15 g, xuan shen (scrophularia root) 10 g. Add 1200 cc of water and simmer down to 500 cc. Strain. Make into 2 servings. Add 1000 cc of water to the herb and re-boil for about 20 minutes. Use it to wash the affected areas. Avoid using cosmetics during the treatment period.
Contraindications:
In rare cases, allergic reactions of discomfort, rash, and itches may appear, possibly with sharp itchiness on the upper limbs, and may cause breathing difficulty.

Prevention: To use bai hua she she cao, start with small amounts such as 10 grams and gradually increase to 30-60 grams.

Antidote: If allergic reactions occur, use chlorpheniramine 4 mg, three times a day, taken orally.
Research:
Bai hua she she cao can activate the reticuloendothelial system and increase phagocytosis by lymphocytes.

In high concentrations, preparations have shown to inhibit cells from acute lymphocytic and acute granulocytic leukemia.

Effective in treatment of appendicitis.

Treatment of snake bites, applied topically and taken orally.

Enhances adrenocortical hormone.

Inhibits sperm production.
Notes: Authenticity note: This herb has been found to be forged with the following plants: 水線草 Hedyotis corymbosa (L.) Lamarck; Oldenlandia corymbosa L.; 松葉耳草 Oldenlandia pinifolia (Wall.) K.Schum; 纖花耳草 Hedyotis tenelliflora Blume; 漆姑草 Sagina japonica (Sw.) Ohwi; 雀舌草 Stellaria uliginosa Murr.

Geography: Yunnan: Fu ling produced in Yunnan is called yun ling
Maladies Treated: Tumors: Fu ling compound was used on 70 different type of tumors. In some cases only fu ling was used, in others fu ling was used with chemo therapy, or radiation therapy or surgery
Side effect of chemotherapy: lessen or prevent side effect of chemo therapy when used with or after chemotherapy
Bone marrow suppression caused by chemotherapy
Impaired liver function: improves liver function
Impaired kidney function: improves kidney function
Nose and throat cancers: improves radiation therapy outcomes
Baldness after giving birth: 10 g fu ling decoction, twice daily, with external bu gu zhi (psoralea) and han lian cao (eclipta) tincture
Urination difficulty due to damp heat
Pixu with mucus production and headache, dizziness, palpitations, with thick greasy tongue coating
Palpitation, insomnia or forgetfulness, loss of appetite
Skin edema (fu ling pi, the skin of fu ling, for ridding skin edema)
Damp-heat (chi fu ling, the light red variety, also called chi fu shen or zhu fu shen)

5 to 15 g per dose; commonly used amount is 5 - 15 g.
Fu ling pi (the skin of fu ling): 15–30 g (normal dosage).

For baldness after giving birth: Use 10 g of fu ling. Make into decoction. Twice a day. Externally apply bu gu zhi (psoralea) and han lian cao (eclipta) tincture. All of the eight patients healed in two months. (Source: Chinese Dermatology Journal)
Contraindications:
Not suitable for patients with yinxu (yin deficiency) condition.
The characteristics of fu ling is that it is more of a diuretic than a tonic herb. Overusage can weaken the eyes.
Not compatible with chronic weakness of the body.
Not to use in cases of shenxu (kidney deficiency) with urinary incontinence, or in cases of clear sperm or spermatorrhea due to yangxu (yang deficiency).
Not compatible with rice vinegar.

《得配本草》：氣虛下陷，水涸口干俱禁用。

《藥性論》：忌米醋。
Research:
Tumors: Fu ling compound was used on 70 different type of tumors. In some cases only fu ling was used, in others fu ling was used with chemo therapy, or radiation therapy or surgery. It showed that fu ling can strengthen the body, improve body weight, improve appetite, lessen or prevent side effect of chemo therapy, protect bone marrow, improve liver and kidney functions, improve radiation therapy on nose and throat cancers. Notes:
Fu ling pi are those fu ling with dark brown skin. Its property is the same as fu ling, and it is specifically effective in ridding skin edema. 

Chi fu ling is the light red variety found near the outer skin. Also called chi fu shen or zhu fu shen. It is used in the treatment of damp-heat. 

Bai fu ling is the white inner part left after removing the outer skin and chi fu ling, also called fu ling. 

Yun ling: Often refers to fu ling produced in Yunnan province, since those are highly valued. 

Fu shen refers to the part around the root, recognized as having a stronger calming effect on emotion. 

Balance with other herbs in case of yinxu condition.

Chi fu ling is the light red variety. It is also called chi fu shen or zhu fu shen.

    are  those after skin or chi fu ling being removed. Also called fu ling.
